channel.title: Vector on Luke Salamone's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Vector on Luke Salamone's Blog

item.title: Learning the Haystack
item.description: Embeddings, or vector representations of a document (which could be a piece of text, image, sound, etc.), can be extremely useful for making sense of large datasets. They transform information into a vector space such that their distance corresponds to their similarity. Enterprising readers might be asking themselves how to get these vectors (also known as embeddings) in the first place. One way is to simply pay for them. This isn’t ideal for a couple of reasons:
